page.title: 18CAMPING WITH CUBS continued
page.content: At 1o'clock we had lunch and washed up.We went for a walk to see the Eastnor Monument, which is an obelisk erected in memory of the son of the man who built Eastnor Castle.When we got back from our walk we played some games until tea.Afterwards we had a camp-fire.At a camp-fire we sing songs and choruses and tell jokes.Then it was time for bed as it was 10:30pm. On Sunday morning soon after breakfast we took down the tents,whilst they were still dry.We cleaned the tent pegs and packed everything away.We spent the rest of the morning until lunch playing games. We visited Eastnor Castle in the afternoon.There are stuffed animals and suits of armour.We went back to camp for tea We had had an enjoyable time and our tent had come second in the "Best Kept Tent" competition!
